article.title: Representation homology of spaces and higher Hochschild homology

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the functor RepG(Γ) represent in terms of the algebraic group G and a discrete group Γ?
choices: The set of all homomorphisms from G to Γ.
The set of all representations of G in Γ.
The set of all families of representations of Γ in G parametrized by the k-scheme Spec(A).
The set of all automorphisms of the group G that fix Γ.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the output of the representation functor ( – )G when applied to a group Γ?
choices: The representation variety of Γ in G.
The character variety of Γ in G.
The coordinate ring of the affine k-scheme RepG(Γ).
The set of all G-orbits in RepG(Γ).

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the representation homology HR∗(X, G) of a reduced simplicial set X in an algebraic group G represent?
choices: The homology of the derived representation scheme DRepG(X).
The cohomology of the representation scheme RepG(X).
The K-theory of the representation variety RepG(X).
The homotopy groups of the algebraic group G.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the relationship between HR∗(X, H) and the Kan loop group construction GX of a reduced simplicial set X?
choices: HR∗(X, H) are the homotopy groups of the simplicial commutative algebra H(GX).
HR∗(X, H) are the cohomology groups of the simplicial group GX.
HR∗(X, H) is the coordinate ring of the representation variety of GX.
HR∗(X, H) represents the character variety of GX.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the pull-back diagram define in terms of a simplicial algebra A∗ and a natural number n?
choices: The simplicial monoid of (n × n)-matrices over A∗ ‘invertible up to homotopy’.
The derived representation scheme of A∗ in GLn.
The representation homology of A∗ in GLn.
The higher Hochschild homology of A∗.
